item.content:encoded:
@1 – You are absolutely right but there are a few pages on the site when the count parameter won’t necessarily be there. For example when you go to ideajam.net I still want the default view to honour the row count that is set in our control panel document. The only way to do this is by changing the form’s default settings.

Matt

item.content:encoded:
Maybe I’m not getting it “right” but AFAIK embedded views in forms respect what the &count= parameters tell them.

So if your form is “myform” the url

{ http://…/myform?openform&count=100″ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }

will have embedded views show 100 lines.

Can this work for you ?
